intro: Stemodiopsis madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar stemodia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions of the island. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
